definition: to open up/to set up/to establish

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to open (a door)/to open up (for development)/to dispel/to refute/to repudiate

sentences.english: This process will certainly open up broad prospects for theoretical innovation.
sentences.chinese: 這一過程必將爲理論創新開闢廣闊前景。

sentences.english: So that a new way to produce high-purity manganese carbonate is opened up.
sentences.chinese: 從而爲高純度碳酸錳的製備開闢了一條新的途徑。

sentences.english: This example indicates a new way of finding new insecticidal crystal protein.
sentences.chinese: 這爲尋找新異殺蟲晶體蛋白基因開闢了新的思路。

sentences.english: As a result, the supervisory organs became dependency on the government and powerful ministers came into being.
sentences.chinese: 監察機構成了政府的附庸，爲權臣的產生開闢了道路。

sentences.english: The concept of satellite network has provided new application directions and developable space for small satellites.
sentences.chinese: 衛星組網爲小衛星開闢了新的應用方向和發展空間。

sentences.english: For the new air route opened up and religious reform provided the necessary conditions.
sentences.chinese: 爲新航路的開闢和宗教改革提供了必要的條件。

sentences.english: The new road was hacked out of the jungle.
sentences.chinese: 這條新路是在叢林地帶開闢出來的。

sentences.english: In this paper, a new way is indicated to the exploitation and utilization of Macrocarpiam officinale.
sentences.chinese: 本研究爲山茱萸的開發利用開闢了新的途徑。

sentences.english: Ferry lines across the Huangpu River will be completed within three months.
sentences.chinese: 三個月後還將開闢橫渡黃浦江的渡輪線。

sentences.english: They used axes to clear a path through the forest.
sentences.chinese: 他們用斧子開闢出一條穿過森林的小道。

sentences.english: This study opens up a new area for mulching materials for dry land wheat.
sentences.chinese: 該項研究爲旱地小麥覆蓋材料開闢了新的領域。

sentences.english: A stream of clear brook opened another realm.
sentences.chinese: 一澗清澈的小溪開闢的另一番境界裏。

sentences.english: Non- motorized access will be in the "three vertical and three horizontal" peripheral gradually open up.
sentences.chinese: 非機動車通道將在“三橫三縱”的周邊陸續開闢。

sentences.english: The exploration of the South China Sea Silk Road began in the Western Han Peniod.
sentences.chinese: 南海絲綢之路的開闢，始於西漢時期。

sentences.english: These biotechnique opened up broad prospects for exploit of microalgae.
sentences.chinese: 這些生物技術爲微藻類的利用開闢了廣闊的前景。

sentences.english: Self-organized criticality opens up a new way to the investigation of disasters.
sentences.chinese: 自組織臨界性爲災害問題的研究開闢了新途徑。

definition: to break new ground (for agriculture)/to open up (a new seam)/to develop (border regions)/fig. to open up (new horizons)
to exploit (a resource)/to open up (for development)/to develop
to construct (often sth abstract, such as good relations)/to set up/to develop/construction (abstract)/architecture
to create/to bring about/to produce/to set (a record)
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
to start using/(computing) to enable (a feature)
